page.title: 16ST OSWALD'S PARISH CHURCH
page.content: St Oswald's Church is 86 years old and there has been a parish church in Knott End since 1899. The present Vicar, Mr Bob Jackson, has lived in Knott End for 16 years and now he, his wife and youngest daughter live in the vicarage. In an interview he said that most of the church-goers are elderly, mainly because so many retired people live in the village. The oldest church member is 96. There are 10 group activities at St Oswald's and his favourites are the youth group and the choir. In his years at St Oswald's only 3 young people have approached him because they want to serve God as ministers, but more people come to church now than did two years ago; 300 people come to the church each week. He is happy because he feels needed by the people but would like to see more care and concern shared by churches.
